text.p: The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien vows to 'earn' votes: Riding high in polls, Chretien warns government not to take Canadians for granted.
- Ontario Health Minister Jim Wilson talks tough to doctors.
- China relentless in pursuit of critics: Ties to West fail to bring changes.
- Breakup of northern region will offer lessons for Quebec, Canada: Dividing assets, liabilities in Northwest Territories may be tense even in friendly split.
- Attack tarnishes Afghanistan rebels' shining armour: Taliban's razing of hamlet shows an ideological war has become an ethnic struggle.
- Canada nears trade deal with Chile.
- Bill Clinton learns from mistakes on economy: No Clintonomics in store if re-elected.
- Canadian tax harmony on long road: Not-so-simple Atlantic plan may make other regions pause.
- Tarxien Corp. lures new cash takeover bid.
- Air fares jump 5 percent to cover fuel costs: But Canadian Airlines International Ltd and Air Canada opt for a deep-discount seat sale to raise some short-term cash.
- Dethroned at home, Molson Cos. Ltd. searches for a new empire.
